intro: Heisteria biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered heister, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It produces small, round berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Heisteria biflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
